intro: Ixoca candavica, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive waxy coating, contributing to its common name. Ixoca candavica is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various soil types.
